intro: Epilobium mexicanum var. paulsenii, commonly known as Mexican willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits compared to other Epilobium species.
